selected_quotes: Comments on Review: “Biomarkers in acute kidney injury – pathophysiological basis and clinical performance” online-

citation.abstract: In March of 2017, Acta Physiologica published a special series on renoprotection, and one of the publications in that series was a review entitled "Biomarkers in acute kidney injury - pathophysiological basis and clinical performance". This review described very well the current understanding of the pathophysiology, cellular localization, and clinical performance of the most important currently proposed biomarkers of AKI, to include insulin-like growth factor binding protein 7 (IGFBP7) and tissue inhibitor of metalloproteinases 2 (TIMP2). At the time that this review was accepted, no work had yet clearly identified the cellular localization of IGFBP7 and TIMP2 in the kidney, and that fact was correctly commented on in the review. This article is protected by copyright. All rights reserved.
citation.title: Comments on the Review “Biomarkers in acute kidney injury - pathophysiological basis and clinical performance” Acta Physiol 2017, 219, 556-574: An update on kidney localization of IGFBP7 and TIMP2
